Name: Astropy
Description: Community core Python library for astronomy/astrophysics (coordinates, time, units, tables), widely used in space observation pipelines.

Name: Astroquery
Description: Astropy-affiliated Python package providing a consistent interface for querying and retrieving data from many online astronomy/planetary archives and services.

Name: SPICE Toolkit (NAIF)
Description: NASA/NAIF SPICE Toolkit: core geometry, time, reference frame, and ephemeris APIs used across planetary missions and science workflows.

Name: SunPy
Description: Open-source solar physics Python environment for searching, downloading, and analyzing solar observation data (maps, time series, solar coordinate frames).

Name: Ames Stereo Pipeline (ASP)
Description: Open-source stereogrammetry and geodesy toolkit to produce DTMs/DEMs and other cartographic products from planetary stereo imagery.

Name: CFITSIO
Description: C/Fortran library for reading and writing FITS files; widely embedded in astronomy data systems and toolchains.

Name: GMAT
Description: NASA’s open-source General Mission Analysis Tool for mission design, trajectory analysis, and navigation trade studies.

Name: ISIS3
Description: USGS Astrogeology’s planetary image processing suite for ingesting, calibrating, mapping, and analyzing mission imagery.

Name: Orekit
Description: Low-level space flight dynamics library (orbits, frames, propagation, OD building blocks) for studies through operations.

Name: PDS4 Tools
Description: Python package (with GUI components) for reading, inspecting, and visualizing NASA PDS4 data and metadata.

Name: Photutils
Description: Astropy coordinated package for source detection and photometry on astronomical imagery (aperture/PSF photometry, segmentation, background estimation).

Name: Skyfield
Description: Pure-Python high-precision ephemerides and position computations for planets and Earth satellites; integrates with Astropy units/time.

Name: Specutils
Description: Astropy coordinated package for representing, loading, and analyzing astronomical spectra; a shared toolbox for spectroscopy workflows.

Name: SpiceyPy
Description: Python wrapper around the SPICE Toolkit, enabling planetary geometry and event-finding workflows in Python.

Name: TudatPy
Description: Python platform for astrodynamics analysis (propagation, estimation, mission design) built on Tudat with examples and docs.

Name: astroplan
Description: Astropy affiliated observation-planning toolkit (visibility windows, constraints, scheduling helpers).

Name: ccdproc
Description: Astropy affiliated package for basic CCD image reduction with error propagation and bad-pixel tracking.

Name: healpy
Description: Python tools for HEALPix maps, widely used for spherical mapping/analysis in astronomy and cosmology.

Name: poliastro
Description: Pure-Python astrodynamics and orbital mechanics library focused on interactive workflows and fast iteration.

Name: regions
Description: Astropy coordinated package for region handling (spatial regions on images/cubes; interoperability for masks/footprints).

Name: reproject
Description: Astropy package for reprojecting astronomical images between world coordinate systems (interpolation/adaptive/exact overlap; includes HEALPix support).

Name: ESA Planetary Science Archive (PSA)
Description: ESA’s central repository for Solar System mission data, distributed in PDS standards for open access and interoperability.

Name: NASA Planetary Data System (PDS)
Description: NASA’s long-term open archive for planetary mission data products, curated for preservation and reuse.

Name: FITS Standard
Description: The formal standard defining the Flexible Image Transport System (FITS), a dominant format for astronomy data transport and archiving.

Name: PDS4 Information Model
Description: Open tooling and artifacts (incl. ontology/model) used to generate and maintain the PDS4 information model.

Name: PDS4 Standards Reference
Description: Primary reference for the PDS4 standard defining structures and rules for planetary data products and labels.

Name: OpenSpace
Description: Open-source astrovisualization software for interactive, presentation-grade exploration of observations and simulations across the known universe.

Name: Stellarium
Description: Open-source planetarium for realistic sky rendering and observation planning across desktop platforms.

Name: WorldWide Telescope WebGL engine
Description: Reusable WebGL/TypeScript rendering engine that power the web-based WorldWide Telescope visualization stack.
